YAHOO.util.Point.name: YAHOO.util.Point

params.name: x
params.description: The X position of the point

params.name: y
params.description: The Y position of the point

constructors.description:
A point is a region that is special in that it represents a single point on 
the grid.

y.description: The Y position of the point, which is also the top, bottom and index one (for Dom.getXY symmetry)

x.description: The X position of the point, which is also the right, left and index zero (for Dom.getXY symmetry)

YAHOO.util.Point.description:
A point is a region that is special in that it represents a single point on 
the grid.

YAHOO.util.Region.name: YAHOO.util.Region

params.name: t
params.description: the top extent

params.name: r
params.description: the right extent

params.name: b
params.description: the bottom extent

params.name: l
params.description: the left extent

constructors.description:
A region is a representation of an object on a grid.  It is defined
by the top, right, bottom, left extents, so is rectangular by default.  If 
other shapes are required, this class could be extended to support it.

return.description: the region's area

getArea.description: Returns the area of the region

return.description: The region that the element occupies

getRegion.description: Returns a region that is occupied by the DOM element

params.name: el
params.description: The element

return.description:
True if the region is contained with this region, 
else false

params.name: region
params.description: The region to evaluate

contains.description: Returns true if this region contains the region passed in

return.description: The union region

params.name: region
params.description: The region that to create the union with

union.description:
Returns the region representing the smallest region that can contain both
the passed in region and this region.

return.description: string the region properties
The overlap region, or null if there is no overlap

params.name: region
params.description: The region that intersects

intersect.description: Returns the region where the passed in region overlaps with this one

1.description: The region's top extent as index, for symmetry with set/getXY

0.description: The region's left extent as index, for symmetry with set/getXY

YAHOO.util.Region.description:
A region is a representation of an object on a grid.  It is defined
by the top, right, bottom, left extents, so is rectangular by default.  If 
other shapes are required, this class could be extended to support it.

Provides helper methods for DOM elements.name: Provides helper methods for DOM elements.
Provides helper methods for DOM elements.shortname: Provides helper methods for DOM elements.

params.name: method
params.description: A boolean method to test elements with

params.name: tag
params.description: (optional) The tag name of the elements being collected

params.name: root
params.description: (optional) The HTMLElement or an ID to use as the starting point

getElementsBy.description:
Returns a array of HTMLElements that pass the test applied by supplied boolean method
For optimized performance, include a tag and/or root node if possible

return.description: The generated ID, or array of generated IDs (or original ID if already present on an element)

params.name: el
params.description: (optional) An optional element array of elements to add an ID to (no ID is added if one is already present)

params.name: prefix
params.description: (optional) an optional prefix to use (defaults to "yui-gen")

return.description: The width of the actual document (which includes the body and its margin).

getDocumentWidth.description: Returns the width of the document.

params.name: el
params.description: Accepts a string to use as an ID, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements.

params.name: property
params.description: The style property to be set.

params.name: val
params.description: The value to apply to the given property.

setStyle.description: Wrapper for setting style properties of HTMLElements.  Normalizes "opacity" across modern browsers.

return.description: The X position of the element(s)

params.name: el
params.description: Accepts a string to use as an ID, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements

getX.description: Gets the current X position of an element based on page coordinates.  The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

return.description: The Y position of the element(s)

params.name: el
params.description: Accepts a string to use as an ID, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements

getY.description: Gets the current Y position of an element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

return.description: An array of elements that have the given class name

params.name: className
params.description: The class name to match against

params.name: tag
params.description: (optional) The tag name of the elements being collected

params.name: root
params.description: (optional) The HTMLElement or an ID to use as the starting point

getElementsByClassName.description:
Returns a array of HTMLElements with the given class
For optimized performance, include a tag and/or root node if possible

params.name: el
params.description: The element or collection to remove the class from

params.name: oldClassName
params.description: the class name to be replaced

params.name: newClassName
params.description: the class name that will be replacing the old class name

replaceClass.description:
Replace a class with another class for a given element or collection of elements.
If no oldClassName is present, the newClassName is simply added.

return.description: The height of the actual document (which includes the body and its margin).

getDocumentHeight.description: Returns the height of the document.

return.description: The height of the viewable area of the page.

getClientHeight.description:
Returns the height of the client (viewport).
Now using getViewportHeight.  This interface left intact for back compat.

return.description: Whether or not the element is present in the current document

params.name: el
params.description: The element to search for

inDocument.description: Determines whether an HTMLElement is present in the current document

return.description: The height of the viewable area of the page (excludes scrollbars).

getViewportHeight.description: Returns the current height of the viewport.

params.name: el
params.description: The element or collection to add the class to

params.name: className
params.description: the class name to add to the class attribute

addClass.description: Adds a class name to a given element or collection of elements

return.description: The width of the viewable area of the page (excludes scrollbars).

getViewportWidth.description: Returns the current width of the viewport.

return.description: A DOM reference to an HTML element or an array of HTMLElements.

params.name: el
params.description: Accepts a string to use as an ID for getting a DOM reference, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements.

params.name: el
params.description: The element or collection to remove the class from

params.name: className
params.description: the class name to remove from the class attribute

removeClass.description: Removes a class name from a given element or collection of elements

return.description: The current value of the style property for the element(s).

params.name: el
params.description: Accepts a string to use as an ID, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements.

params.name: property
params.description: The style property whose value is returned.

params.name: el
params.description: Accepts a string to use as an ID, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements

params.name: pos
params.description: Contains X & Y values for new position (coordinates are page-based)

params.name: noRetry
params.description: By default we try and set the position a second time if the first fails

setXY.description:
Set the position of an html element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned.
The element(s) must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

params.name: el
params.description: Accepts a string to use as an ID, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements.

params.name: x
params.description: to use as the X coordinate for the element(s).

setX.description:
Set the X position of an html element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

params.name: el
params.description: Accepts a string to use as an ID, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements.

params.name: x
params.description: to use as the Y coordinate for the element(s).

setY.description:
Set the Y position of an html element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

params.type:
String/HTMLElement/Array} el Accepts a string to use as an ID, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements

params.name: The
params.description: XY position of the element(s)

getXY.description: Gets the current position of an element based on page coordinates.  Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

return.description: The width of the viewable area of the page.

getClientWidth.description:
Returns the width of the client (viewport).
Now using getViewportWidth.  This interface left intact for back compat.

return.description: A Region or array of Region instances containing "top, left, bottom, right" member data.

params.name: el
params.description: Accepts a string to use as an ID, an actual DOM reference, or an Array of IDs and/or HTMLElements.

getRegion.description:
Returns the region position of the given element.
The element must be part of the DOM tree to have a region (display:none or elements not appended return false).

return.description: The element(s) with the method applied

params.name: el
params.description: (optional) An element or array of elements to apply the method to

params.name: method
params.description: The method to apply to the element(s)

params.name: o
params.description: (optional) An optional arg that is passed to the supplied method

params.name: override
params.description: (optional) Whether or not to override the scope of "method" with "o"

batch.description:
Returns an array of elements that have had the supplied method applied.
The method is called with the element(s) as the first arg, and the optional param as the second ( method(el, o) )

return.description: Whether or not the haystack is an ancestor of needle

params.name: haystack
params.description: The possible ancestor

params.name: needle
params.description: The possible descendent

isAncestor.description: Determines whether an HTMLElement is an ancestor of another HTML element in the DOM hierarchy

return.description: A boolean value or array of boolean values

params.name: el
params.description: The element or collection to test

params.name: className
params.description: the class name to search for

hasClass.description: Determines whether an HTMLElement has the given className

classlist: Provides helper methods for DOM elements.
